links.title: TSMC's Arizona Fab Hiring Woes Prompt Calls for Willing Taiwanese Migrants
links.description: Taiwan's Liberty Times revealed today that TSMC has considerably relaxed requirements for Taiwanese residents interested in pursuing a career in the company's stateside operations. In a headline, it jokes that those with just a high school diploma can snag a TSMC factory technician job in Arizona.

$SPY $TSLA $AAPL $FB $MSFT 

My thoughts on stocks next week  ...  

You want to know why people subscribe to my service?

Preperation. I called 451/452 on the SPY as a top and 426/427 as a bottom for this week. We hit both those levels.  Remember, technicals first. Then fundamentals. In that order. 

I told members at the beginning of the week in my Game Plan that Thursday would be the MOST important day of the week (SEE ATTACHED BELOW). For two reasons - 1) although I expected a solid qtr out of TSLA, we get to see how Wall Street treats the shares. I told members that if the stock gives up its gains, the mkt is in trouble. 2) Powell speaks and he will undoubtedly talk the mkt lower. 

Thursday indeed turned out to be the most important day for the very two reasons I gave. 

Point is, I prepare members for the week. That is the whole point of my Game Plans and daily commentary. 

To join, reach out at jessielivermore1929@gmail.com

links.title: EU agrees on landmark law aimed at forcing Big Tech firms to tackle illegal content
links.description: The European Union agreed on new digital regulations Saturday that will force tech giants like Google and Meta to police illegal content on their platforms more aggressively, or else risk potential multibillion-dollar fines.
